intro: Campylocentrum organense, commonly known as the Mexican starfruit or organensis starfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Marcgraviaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Mexico and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy, dark green appearance. Campylocentrum organense is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
